page.title: 03Buscough Landscape (cont)
page.content: The industrial estate is built on the site of a former airfield and is linked to the A59,the main north to south route through south west Lancashire.To the extreme south east is a post war housing estate representing the growth of Burscough away from the A59,housing not farmers but mainly commuters and local service and factory workers.The present landscape owes something to the drainage of a lake,Martin Mere,the building of a canal and railway,the industrial utilization of a disused airfield and to an influx of commuters in the housing estate.Present day inhabitants have their livelihoods linked to these phases.Older people recall the busy days of the canal when coal,cotton and grain where moved to and from Liverpool and when many families worked on barges at New Lane.
